column4: I can't find anything on how to mount with xubuntu, and all of the command line instructions i can find are for dappy (I'm on edgy). help?
the file listing the mounts changed for edgy right?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Mount
wiki only has instructions for ubuntu, using the graphical mouunter in gnome, im on xubuntu
No
just follow the link I have given
have you mount a linux part or win part ?
linux, ex2
and its empty (except for t he lost+found folder)
there are other tutorials for mount in the wiki.
does it have rw persmission for all ?
if i were to guess, i would say only root, but mount doesn't say who its rw for
file manager says root only, how can i change that?
have you tried chmod - R 755 /path/to/mount ?
sorry 777
or try to write to the mount as a root
that did the trick, thanks. I've never used chmod before, try to remember it for future use. maybe add that to the wiki! thanks again!
if you have used 777 that's a big security hole. trying to own the mound with chown -R my_user /path/to/mount might be a better solution
roger that, i should set it back to 755 first?
depending on your requirements. Having that said 755 is the defacto standard . But that depends as I told
ok, i think i get it. thanks again.
